citation.article-title: Acetonema longum gen. nov. sp. nov., an H2/CO2 acetogenic bacterium from the termite, Pterotermes occidentis.

p.s: Acetonema (A.ce.to.ne'ma. L.n. acetum vinegar; nema thread; M.L. neut. n. Acetonema vinegar-forming thread)
Thin, straight rods with rounded ends, measuring 0.3-0.4 Î¼m in diameter and exhibiting a length to width ratio of 10-100 to 1.
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Gram-negative by staining and by cell wall ultrastructure.
Heat-resistant, dipicolinic acid-containing endospores are formed.
Sugars and organic acids are also fermented yielding a mixture of products, including acetate, propionate, butyrate, succinate, H2 and CO2, depending on the substrate.
Do not respire anaerobically with nitrate or sulfate.
DNA base composition: 51.5 mol% G + C (for the type species).
